title: Verify no text overlap in Problem Section 'The Reality' on desktop
description: Check that the section title, labels, card numbers, and card titles do not visually overlap or collide when viewed on desktop viewport.

steps.description: Navigate to the landing page and scroll down to the Problem Section labeled 'The Reality'
Inspect the bounding rectangles of section title, labels, card numbers, and card titles using layout inspection tools
Confirm no intersection between bounding rectangles of the key text elements
Visually verify that text elements do not overlap or get clipped

title: Check CSS style properties related to text layout in Problem Section
description: Verify CSS properties like line-height, margin-bottom, padding, min-height, and height constraints on the text elements in the Problem Section.

steps.description: Open the ProblemSection.tsx and corresponding style sheets
Check line-height values on section titles, labels, card numbers, and card titles
Verify margin-bottom and padding are sufficient to prevent text collisions
Confirm flexible height properties (min-height or auto height) are used for cards
All relevant text elements have explicit line-height set and consistent margin/padding to avoid overlap
Card heights are flexible and do not cause content clipping

title: Test responsive layout for Problem Section on mobile small viewport (320x568)
description: Ensure that on a small mobile viewport, all text elements in the Problem Section are readable and do not overlap.

steps.description: Simulate or use a device of 320 pixels width by 568 pixels height
Navigate to the Problem Section 'The Reality'
Confirm that section title, labels, card numbers, and card titles are fully visible without overlap
Check that no horizontal scroll or clipping occurs

title: Test responsive layout for Problem Section on mobile medium viewport (375x667)
description: Verify the display of section titles, labels, and cards in the Problem Section on a medium mobile resolution without text overlap.

steps.description: Set viewport size to 375px width and 667px height
Navigate and review the Problem Section 'The Reality'
No text collisions or visual clipping among the text elements

title: Test responsive layout for Problem Section on tablet viewport (768px wide)
description: Confirm the layout integrity and absence of overlapping text in the Problem Section when viewed on a tablet-sized viewport.

steps.description: Configure viewport width to 768 pixels
Scroll to the Problem Section 'The Reality'
Verify visually and programmatically that no overlap or collision occurs in text elements

title: Validate impact of GSAP animations on text overlap in Problem Section
description: Test if GSAP animation transforms cause any text overlapping or layout issues in 'The Reality' subsection.

steps.description: Load the page with GSAP animations enabled and observe the Problem Section
Ensure no text overlapping or visual artifacts occur while animations are running
Temporarily disable GSAP animations
Confirm that disabling GSAP removes any overlapping issues if they existed

title: Verify padding and positioning CSS fixes prevent text overlap
description: Apply recommended CSS changes to min-height, padding, and line-height and validate that these changes resolve overlaps without introducing new issues.

steps.description: Apply CSS adjustments as recommended to ProblemSection styles
Reload the Problem Section in multiple viewport sizes
No overlap or clipping occurs in any text elements
Spacing between text elements remains visually consistent and clean

title: Isolate debugging scope to ProblemSection.tsx and related styles
description: Ensure all code changes and fixes for text overlap issues are contained only within ProblemSection.tsx and its relevant styles, preventing side effects elsewhere.

steps.description: Review code commits and diffs to confirm only ProblemSection.tsx and related CSS files are modified
No unintended changes to other components or global styles
Perform sanity regression tests on unrelated components to ensure no impact
